title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: Very calm and smooth interview despite the physicians being extremely busy; staff are very helpful. They will show you around the facilities and make you have a feel for a typical work day
Interview Questions: Why did you choose us?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: It was great interview process. All the principle investigators were interested in my experience. They were very friendly and open to me asking many questions. I was nervous given the prestige of the university and the position but they made me feel very welcomed.
Interview Questions: Which research method are you most familiar with.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Called for an interview for what started as a receptionist position; turned into administrative assistant position. Flawless interview; was provided details for second interview and then ended up having second interview at that tome
Interview Questions: Why would I want to come work at Howard?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: It was brief, informative. It was like having a conversation so I really liked that. It lasted for only about 30 minutes and I just had to talk about myself and what set me apart from other candidates.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about yourself?

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward and informative. I learned about the organization and the benefits offered. I felt comfortable during the interview and found the interviewer easygoing.  I was offered a position and accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: What are your short term and long term goals.

title: Teching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: There really was not an interview process. I was selected as a TA based on the grade in that class and how well I work with students. The professor just needed help and I helped.
Interview Questions: Do you have time to host study sessions for students?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview format with basic questions, first there were group interviews then after were individual ones. Then afterwards you hope to receive an offer based on if the community manager would like to select you.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be a resident assistant

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews. They were both fairly low pressure and overall positive experiences.  Questions like "Walk me through your resume" or STAR method questions were used. The second interview was more conversational based with the President and involved more questions based around character, background and values. It felt like a good space to be in.
Interview Questions: "Walk me through your resume"

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: I am not sure for this employer for  my position was student and part time for this employer during the time I was there; thus is not contingent to full employment
Interview Questions: I am not sure for this employer for  my position student and was part time for this employer during the time I was there

title: Dental Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interactive interview determining your strength ,weakness , long term goal and expectations . What is your vision and how you see yourself in 5 years and what do you plan to do for that
Interview Questions: What is your long term goal ?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a position at the school of communication in the film department. Did a skype interview and surprisingly, the next day they invited me to an on-campus interview. Right of the bat, they proved to be disorganized and unprofessional.  Communication was minimal. I had to ask repeatedly for an agenda for the interview. All I got was a screenshot of a message sent by the search committee chair asking the staff about room availability! Nonetheless, I took one of my presentations with me to play it safe. On the day of the interview, the staff was confused/misinformed about the start time. They had me come in over an hour earlier but the faculty seemed to go with the flow and we got started right away. The most remarkable thing was the repetition of the questions from the original skype interview. We basically had the same conversation twice! Off course they expected me to do a presentation as well! Unlike other institutions I have interviewed, there was no tour of the facilities, no offer to go to lunch or drop off at the airport. Not that I expect to be fed or transported but it shows professionalism. Anyway, all this is minor compared to the real reason I am giving Howard a negative review. it is solely because I have not heard one word from them in almost 5  months! Not a 'thank you for coming in' , or the standard, 'thanks but we went in a different direction' email. I on the other hand, thanked them individually for inviting me to campus. Not only that, I have written, multiple times, several of the people involved asking for an updated. No response as of this posting. Now, many schools don't update you after receiving and rejecting a cv; few even don't update you after the initial video/phone interview but I have never, not received, at least an email after an on-campus, 2nd round interview. That's just rude and utterly unprofessional. I have moved on, and happy to report that another university, ranked far above and polar opposite to Howard, offered a position that I enthusiastically accepted.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Database Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 phone interviews and then one on-site interview. The first phone interview was to know my background and discuss the position. In second phone interview, I was asked about my projects and past work experience. During on-site interview, they asked me basic questions of SQL and Python and asked about the difficulties I faced in these 2 languages and how I overcome it. Received an offer after 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Basics of Relational database and SQL

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was via the phone. I was asked questions about my coding experience, as well as questions about working with children. The interviewer was very polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend.
Interview Questions: Have I ever lead a coding camp before

title: Nurse Emergency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great process talked a lot very informative. Easy and quick process. I shared my strengths and weaknesses. I said I’m a hard worker and team player . And I am organized.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: After placement, an interview was conducted to see if I was the right fit for the unit. It was relatively straightforward, with basic interview questions. Be sure to think of skills you already have from your past experiences and relate them to the general function of the unit.
Interview Questions: What are some of the skills you possess?

title: Assistant Director, Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: Surprisingly quick. I applied online.  Was called for an interview in a about a week.  Met the Director on Thursday and Recruitment extended an offer on Friday. I only met with one person.
Interview Questions: To do a case study test via computer.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: I was a student at the school and I saw I posting online about a vacancy so I emailed the person in charge. She emailed me and from there I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admission Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online within two weeks received
a phone call from HR for an interview in a week. I waited 15 mins passed my scheduled time for my interview to begin even though I arrived 15 mins early. Finally arrived for the interview with Director
and a member of the staff. The member of
the staff walked out and returned during the interview including the director. They questions asked were scripted and reflected  no interest. I was told they didn't know what position I was interviewing for but will place me where they wanted to place me. By far the worse interview for a university with such prestige. They need to fired admission management and seek professional qualified ones, I simply decline the offer that office seem too unorganized
Interview Questions: How can I contribute to the team?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Howard University (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fine nothing bad happened it's a great interview just don't be nervous be yourself you'll do fine don't worry be yourself you'll be fine don't worry be yourself you'll be fine don't worry be yourself don't be worried the yourself be yourself be yourself be yourself be yourself be yourself be yourself
Interview Questions: what was one thing they

title: Attorney Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough examination of past performance and experience.  The General Counsel and Deputy Genera Counsel were very pleasant.  I left feeling that they had conducted an excellent interview.  I had a very positive feeling upon leaving the interview.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Really Quick, HR called and set up an interview with the Dean. The process was through a staffing agency, Randstad. Fairly easy. Didn't last longer then 30 min. The staffing agency, prior to sending you to companys to interview give you a Microsoft  office assessment and preliminary interview. They were very helpful in pre interview preparation.
Interview Questions: Why should we higher you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to attend a lab meeting and was interviewed by the PI and the PostDoc. They called me in and had me meet the rest of the lab to see if I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions:
WHat are your interests?
Years of experience?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: General application submission. Go online and find the graduate application process and complete the tasks. If you know of a professor you want to work with, contact them and tell them that you are applying.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Radar Meteorology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and the recruiter contacted after like a week. We had 30 min phone interview . She got back to me a couple of days later to schedule a technical interview with the hiring manager.  I was allowed a lot of flexibility on  the timing for the interview. The interview was conducted by the hiring manager and a few other people. They were really nice.
Interview Questions: Basic concept of weather radar

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: This is different depending on the position for which one is applying.  Initially, there was a phone interview, then an on-campus interview.  The phone interview was more informal, but the on-campus interview was very formal.  The on-campus interview was only a couple of hours and they paid for me to visit the campus.
Interview Questions: How will a postdoctoral position benefit your career?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Not really an interview. I know the professor and when he had a grant, he contacted me. We just went over what the position will require and  if I will be willing to accept the offer. Once we agreed, then we involved the Human Resources which then took it from there.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in this position?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with recruiter.  He referred me to another vacant position which ultimately proved to be a better fit for both me and the organization.  Recruiter set up an  interview with the hiring department official for the same day and I was hired me on spot.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?  That question always stumps me

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University
Interview Descriptions: applied online and received a cal back, went in for an interview and it was pretty standard, pay attention to questions other people are asked they want to to remember. It was a group interview, those can always be a little intimidating but in the end it worked out to our advantage it relaxed the nerves you get from interview
Interview Questions: the most difficult was trying to explain your weaknesses without seeming like a bad pick

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and very straightforward. My Dean and I had a conversation about her expectations of me, and I did the same. She explained to me the hierarchy of the office and the work hours that were available. I was dealing with confidential information and had to be willing to sign a confidentiality agreement.
Interview Questions:
How many activities were you involved in? 
How large is your course load?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was of medium difficulty. Took quite a while to get hired and begin working. Although the opportunity was well worth the wait. Background check was required as well as thorough reference check. Interview process was a learning experience.
Interview Questions: Interview was of medium difficulty.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very short. I applied online and knew many people who worked for the University. The people I knew who worked the University already may have been very beneficial in helping me obtain this job. The interview was very short and sweet and straight to the point.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, and straightforward. Just act professional and be sure to be able to explain your past experiences and accomplishments well and clearly. Be sure that you familiarize yourself with CPT, as Howard, an HBCU, operates on this. It really isn't that bad. Really. It isn't. Keep Calm and Relax. Everything will work out fine.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Howard University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application process takes months.  Verification is done only for those who lists advance degree.
Interview Questions: Will you be able to work on a 24 hour shift?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was relatively easy. First was the HR screening. Following the HR screening, I was invited to meet with the Director of the Center with other panels. It was a 30 minute interview. The process was relatively easy
Interview Questions: It was heavily behavioral and less about skills

title: Clinical Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Complete Application online, phone interview,Face to face interview,Offer letter 4-6 week to hire. The process was not bad it was the length of time between getting hired that was the issue. While I waited on a start date I took a temp job
Interview Questions:
What is do you bring to the table that would make you the best candidate for this position?
How would you Experience advance departmental goals of the 
How would you handle disgruntled employees/patients

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Howard University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard academic interview. I knew the people from previous contacts so it was fairly relaxed. I talked about my research experience and we discussed the possible projects that I could pursue if I were to join. We'd had some previous discussions on the phone and over e-mail so it was not hard to reach an agreement.
Interview Questions: There were no real gotcha questions as it wasn't that type of interview.
